title: Saddleback Horn
text:
The Horn (or Saddleback Horn) is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> located in <a href="Franklin%20County%2C%20Maine">Franklin County</a>, <a href="Maine">Maine</a>. The Horn is flanked to the southwest by the main summit of <a href="Saddleback%20Mountain%20%28Rangeley%2C%20Maine%29">Saddleback Mountain</a>, to the northeast by <a href="Saddleback%20Junior">Saddleback Junior</a>, and to the northwest by Potato Nubble.
The Horn drains to the northeast into Redington Stream, then into the <a href="South%20Branch%20Dead%20River">South Branch</a> of the <a href="Dead%20River%20%28Kennebec%20River%29">Dead River</a>, the <a href="Kennebec%20River">Kennebec River</a>, and into the <a href="Gulf%20of%20Maine">Gulf of Maine</a>. The Horn drains to the west into Saddleback Lake, then into Redington Stream. The Horn drains to the south into Winship Stream, then into Conant Stream, Orbeton Stream, and the <a href="Sandy%20River%20%28Kennebec%20River%29">Sandy River</a>, another <a href="tributary">tributary</a> of the Kennebec. The Horn drains to the southeast into Hardy Stream, then into Orbeton Stream.
The <a href="Appalachian%20Trail">Appalachian Trail</a>, a <a href="National%20Scenic%20Trail">National Scenic Trail</a> from <a href="Georgia%20%28U.S.%20state%29">Georgia</a> to <a href="Maine">Maine</a>, runs along the ridge of Saddleback, including the summit of The Horn.
